title: Clinic Closes But Workers Say Their Services Are Still Needed
teaser: A Minneapolis clinic that has provided low-cost care to uninsured and underinsured people for 42 years has closed it doors. Revenue from paying patients is down 30 percent because the Affordable Care Act has allowed many to buy health insurance. The largely volunteer staff say their services are still in demand because many people in the area remain uninsured for a variety of reasons.
